column4: Can anyone help me out? How do I mount an iso in ubuntu so a program will recognize it as if I had a disk in?
I tried mounting it to media/iso but the program still asks for me to insert the disk
there are a couple options, easiest might be to use gmountiso: sudo apt-get install gmountiso
thanks, I'll give it a shot
thanks, is there a way I could do this without this program? Just curious, cuz when I started this and I was getting this error I wasn't connected to the net, so no way to get any other program
yep, look at the ubottu answer for !iso
sudo mount -o loop <ISO-filename> <mountpoint>
I did that, but the program kept asking for me to insert the disk.. It was like it was mounting only so I could access the info on the iso, but not as a virtual drive
Btw, how do I work this program.. Lol
hmm that is strange, never had any problems, you might want to post in forums and include more info about the iso
have you tried the sudo mount method with other .iso files?
Gmountiso shows up in System Tools, it's pretty straightforward :)
hmm i thought this one was not working properly?
It's not the iso that's the problem.. I guess I'll start with the beginning..

I installed a game with this iso.. it worked fine until I tried to run the game, where it then asked for the disk to be inserted.. Now I'm trying to figure out how to mount the iso in some kind of a virtual disk form
ah ok, what's the game? probably you are running into their copy protection scheme :)
Probably.. It's gta vice city, running through wine
But on the readme it says that the game runs fine so long as you keep the disk in / keep the iso mounted
Actually it's the same iso I used on windows, and the game ran perfectly if I kept the iso mounted with daemon - tools
that is because daemon-tools has special emulation options designed to bypass the ISO copy protections :)
Is there no way to do that on ubuntu?
Will this work? http://megagames.com/cgi/download/download.cgi?action=search&category=cracks&search=GRAND.THEFT.AUTO.VICE.CITY.V1.0.ENG.GIMPSRUS.NOCD.ZIP
you might be interested in http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=631185 , what you need is Wine to properly support SecuROM v4 with mounted ISOs
